snippet: Saudi Arabia’s alarm over the nuclear deal comes after a trove of documents revealed its efforts in recent years to undermine its primary adversary: Shiite Iran.
abstract: Newly released WikiLeaks documents show Saudi Arabia's global attempts in recent years to undermine its main enemy, Shiite Iran; documents portray comprehensive competition with deep roots in religious ideologies that drive two countries; array of oil-funded operation illustrates Saudi's alarm at nuclear program deal reached by world powers with Iran.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan; and Suhasini Raj from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia’s alarm over the nuclear deal comes after a trove of documents revealed its efforts in recent years to undermine its primary adversary: Shiite Iran.

headline.main: WikiLeaks Shows a Saudi Obsession With Iran
headline.print_headline: A Saudi Obsession With Politics and Religion
